name: riboseq-stress-response
title: Stress Response Translation (Ribosome Profiling)
description: Analyze translation dynamics during cellular stress. Identifies stress-induced translation reprogramming, preferential translation of stress response genes, and ribosome stalling patterns. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,replicate`
content:
Stress Response Translation Analysis

During cellular stress (heat shock, oxidative stress, ER stress, hypoxia), translation is globally repressed but specific mRNAs are preferentially translated. Ribosome profiling reveals this reprogramming.

Stress-Induced Translation Reprogramming

Global Translation Shutoff: Most mRNAs stop being translated

Preferential Translation: Stress response genes maintain or increase translation:

  • Heat shock proteins (HSPs)
  • Chaperones (BiP, GRP94)
  • Antioxidant enzymes
  • Autophagy genes
  • Apoptosis regulators
  • Transcription factors (ATF4, NRF2)

Stress Types Studied

  • Heat Shock: HSP induction, protein folding
  • ER Stress: Unfolded protein response (UPR)
  • Oxidative Stress: Antioxidant response
  • Hypoxia: HIF-1α and metabolic adaptation
  • Nutrient Deprivation: Amino acid starvation, mTOR inhibition
  • Viral Infection: Integrated stress response (ISR)

Scientific Applications

  • Stress Signaling: ISR, UPR, oxidative stress pathways
  • Cancer: Tumor stress adaptation, therapy resistance
  • Neurodegeneration: Protein aggregation, ER stress
  • Aging: Proteostasis decline
  • Drug Development: Stress pathway inhibitors
  • Viral Infection: Host shutoff mechanisms

Pipeline Features

  • Stress-Control Comparison: Differential translation analysis
  • Ribosome Stalling: Detect stalled ribosomes during stress
  • uORF Translation: Regulatory uORFs (e.g., ATF4, CHOP)
  • IRES Activity: Cap-independent translation
  • Polysome Profiling: Global translation state
  • Time Course: Translation dynamics over stress response

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with Ribo-seq samples from:

  • sample: Sample identifier (control vs stress conditions)
  • fastq_1: Ribo-seq reads
  • type: riboseq
  • strandedness: Usually forward for Ribo-seq

Experimental Design: Include time points (0h, 2h, 4h, 8h) to capture dynamics.

Key Outputs

  • Differentially Translated Genes: Stress vs control
  • Translation Efficiency Changes: Per-gene TE shifts
  • Ribosome Occupancy: Global translation state
  • Stalling Events: Ribosome pausing sites
  • uORF Activation: Regulatory ORF translation

Perfect for: Stress biology • Integrated stress response • Proteostasis • Cancer stress adaptation • Viral infection
